info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:39PM EDT until August 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN LAPEER...OAKLAND...SOUTHEASTERN SHIAWASSEE... LIVINGSTON AND SOUTHERN GENESEE COUNTIES... At 439 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ortonville to near Holly to near Oak Grove, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Ortonville around 445 PM EDT. Oxford and Clarkston around 450 PM EDT. Milford around 500 PM EDT. Pontiac and South Lyon around 505 PM EDT. Rochester around 510 PM EDT. Troy, Southfield and Birmingham around 515 PM EDT. Novi, Royal Oak, Northville and West Bloomfield around 520 PM EDT. Warren, Sterling Heights and Detroit Zoo around 525 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Franklin, Keego Harbor, Waterford, Orchard Lake, Rankin, Holly State Recreation Area, Commerce, Rose Center, Conway Township and Lathrup Village. People attending Pine Knob Music Theatre should seek safe shelter immediately! HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
